Membership
Membership
Help support wildlife in Cape Coral by becoming a member, or renewing your membership.
All monies received by Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife are used to help protect the wildlife of Cape Coral. Our organization is volunteer-only, we have no paid staff. Your donation is tax-deducible as current law allows.
Membership includes a discount on CCFW merchandise.

THE FLORIDA REGISTRATION NUMBER FOR CAPE CORAL FRIENDS OF WILDLIFE, INC., IS CH36450. A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL FREE (800-435-7352) WITHIN THE STATE OR GOING TO THE WEBSITE FOR THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES (WWW.FLORIDACONSUMERHELP.COM).  REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY EDORSEMENT, APPROVAL, OR RECOMMNDATION BY THE STATE.
Membership Form

PDF form
and send it along with your check or money order for the membership level desired to:
Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife
Attn: Treasurer
P.O. Box 152761
Cape Coral, FL 33915

Home
5
Support CCFW
Support CCFW
There are number of ways you can support our mission, including becoming a member, donating and volunteering for events and operations.
Join/Renew Membership
Help support wildlife in Cape Coral by becoming a member, or renewing your existing membership.
Donate to CCFW
Make a tax deductible donation to support Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife and our mission to protect and educate.
Adopt an Owl
Adopt a Cape Coral Burrowing Owl to help fund burrow maintenance activities and other programs.
Shop CCFW Merchandise
Get some unique apparel, wear your support for Cape Coral's wildlife and help further our mission by shopping CCFW merchandise.
Get Involved
Volunteer with Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife and make a difference educating and benefiting our community.
Help Preserve Land
Our sister organization, Cape Coral Wildlife Trust, is actively seeking donations to help acquire vacant parcels that support important wildlife habitat within the city.

FAQ

Who to Contact
Who to Contact
Depending on the location and issue, there are a number of organizations and government agencies who may be able to help address your questions or concern.
Volunteer Organizations
For general questions or requests concerning Burrowing Owls, Gopher Tortoises and other native wildlife in Cape Coral:
Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife (CCFW)
239-980-2593
For
injured wildlife:
Clinic for the Rehabilitation of Wildlife (CROW)
239-472-3644
City of Cape Coral Departments
For suspected violations of the city’s protected species ordinance (Burrowing Owls, Gopher Tortoises, Bald Eagle) or other codes :
City of Cape Coral Code Enforcement
239-574-0613
Concerning Monitor Lizards and other exotic/invasive reptiles:
City of Cape Coral
Environmental Resources Department
239-574-0785
For information on wildlife at Rotary Park:
City of Cape Coral Rotary Park Environmental Center
239-549-4606
State Agencies
Harassment or mortalities of wildlife, especially protected species such as
Burrowing Owls, Gopher Tortoises, Manatees, Bald Eagles, Scrub Jays:
Florida Fish & Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC)
888-404-3922
Concerning water quality, pollution or wetlands destruction:
Florida Department of Environmental Protection (DEP)
South District
239-344-5600

Home
5
News & About CCFW
5
About Us
About Us
Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife
is a volunteer organization whose purpose is to preserve and enhance the habitats of protected wildlife species and to educate the community about Cape Coral’s wildlife resources.
Back in the 1960’s the Rosen Brothers came to Cape Coral to build a massive waterfront community. They brought in the largest collection of earth moving equipment that had ever been seen in Florida and proceeded to level 100 square miles of land and dig 400 miles of canals.
The large variety of wildlife that lived here was decimated.  What was once lush wooded areas, beautiful meadows, pristine streams, was reduced to a near wasteland.
As most of the wildlife left to find suitable habitat, the Burrowing Owls that lived in the outskirts of Lee County and Central Florida, found this prairie like habitat ideal, and began to move in and flourish.
As Cape Coral grows, the Florida
Scrub Jays
, the
Burrowing Owls
, the
Gopher Tortoise
and the
Bald Eagles
and other wildlife that remain in the City are again at risk for extreme habitat loss.
Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife is working hard to preserve the habitat that our wildlife so desperately needs. All funding to keep this organization running is received from donations.
If you would like to  help preserve the wildlife in Cape Coral, consider a tax-exempt
donation
. CCFW is a 501-C-3 organization, and all donations are tax deductible as allowed by law. No fees are paid to professional fund-raising consultants or solicitors. The organization receives 100% of each donation.

Events & Programs
Events & Programs
Browse the Cape Coral Friends of Wildlife Events Calendar and learn more about our various programs.
General Meetings
View more information about our general meetings and upcoming guest speakers.
Burrowing Owl Festival
Participate in one of the most unique events in Southwest Florida! Saturday, February 28, 2026 at Rotary Park.
Loading…
Visit the Butterfly House
The Tom Allen Memorial Butterfly House is one of Cape Coral's top attractions and a labor of love for many CCFW volunteers.
Burrow Maintenance Program
Join our team of volunteers performing maintenance around owl burrows to help one these lovable creatures thrive.
Request a Speaker
CCFW volunteers are available to speak to students and civic associations about protecting Cape Coral's wildlife and habitats.
